content: What do folks think about making the night theme the default for new users? I feel like it gets better feedback from design-focused folks, and a large number of users have switched.

I still prefer the day theme. I'm not sure how much anecdotal feedback is gonna help here, though, including mine. Is there a way to test out how much people prefer night theme vs. it just being a vocal minority? (I'm not saying night theme people are inherently more vocal, just that they're more likely to speak up about it since it probably feels now like a "feature" than a natural choice.)
Well, in chat.zulip.org, 945/15K people currently have the night theme set.
Let me do the join against users who've sent over 100 messages, since that's probably the right population to look at.

There's always the New Coke/Classic Coke marketing scheme, which I suspect most folks here are too young the remember (mid 80s), at least viscerally. If we introduce the night theme as a the default, maybe we'll stir up new passion for the day theme. :)
OK, 87/390 of all users who've sent more than 100 messages in this community are on the night theme.
Which is a lot for an option you need to select, and that query may include users who stopped using Zulip before we added the feature.
22.3% is indeed a lot for an opt-in feature

Steve Howell said:

There's always the New Coke/Classic Coke marketing scheme, which I suspect most folks here are too young the remember (mid 80s), at least viscerally. If we introduce the night theme as a the default, maybe we'll stir up new passion for the day theme. :slight_smile:

I have almost every application set to night mode on all my systems. The reason is just that it's easier on the eyes, and I think that is true for a lot of other people.

I say we show a banner the second or third time someone logs in to Zulip, that has a 1 click night mode toggle, but we keep day mode as a default. But that may just be because I stay on day mode by default.

Discord is dark by default (and I would never consider discord day mode, I'd rather just quit).
Slack has many many themes, but their default is a bit less bright than ours.

Maybe the real problem is that we should switch the background from pure white to a more off white...

Vinit Singh said:

I have almost every application set to night mode on all my systems. The reason is just that it's easier on the eyes, and I think that is true for a lot of other people.

FWIW, I've started switching between night and day modes (with an automated script), based on whether I'm sitting indoors or outdoors. I find dark mode hard to read when I'm outdoors. Otherwise, I prefer dark mode too, since it feels a lot easier on my eyes.
Also, I'm really glad we have an API end-point to change the modes, instead of it being some setting or a cookie in the client. :slight_smile:
how... does your script know if you're indoors or outdoors?
haha, I have to run it - it has a toggle mode, or I can explicitly ask for one of these modes - day/night.
